message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CY 

This paper is about combining two popular approaches to automated Grammatical Error Correction (GEC): GEC based on Statistical Machine Translation (SMT) and GEC based on Neural Machine Translation (NMT). Therefore, it is likely to belong to the following sub-categories: 

- cs.CL (Computation and Language): This sub-category deals with natural language processing, which is the main focus of this paper. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): This sub-category covers a wide range of topics related to AI, including machine learning and natural language processing, which are relevant to this paper. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category focuses on machine learning algorithms and techniques, which are used in both SMT and NMT approaches. 
- cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing): This sub-category deals with neural networks and other computational models inspired by biological systems, which are used in NMT. 
- cs.CY (Computers and Society): This sub-category covers the social and ethical implications of computing, which may be relevant to the use of automated GEC systems.
